page.title: 13The museum in Brook
page.content: The museum in Brook is in a tithe barn which was built in the fourteenth century. It was uised originally to store crops. Every farmer had to give one tenth of his crops to the monks of Canterbury who owned this barn and these were stored here. Nowadays the barn is full of old agricultural machinery, mostly Victorian. The most interesting things are the old farm waggons. There is a Kent Waggon which is blue and a Thanet waggon and a Sussex waggon. At the back of the barn is a nineteenth century oast house. This is part of the museum and also has lots of old tools and rat traps in it.
